The company's stock price is plummeting after an E. coli outbreak linked to its food sickened dozens of people in several states, far more than the initial reported number.

"Chipotle Mexican Grill shares sank more than 6% in early trading Tuesday after a report that the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has identified 45 cases of E. coli infections across six states connected to the restaurant chain," reports CNN Money.
The affected states include California, Illinois, Maryland, Minnesota, Ohio, and Washington.
